column4: EN
Are you the one who is going around school saying tic tac toe is a stupid game for little kids?
column5: ¿Eres tú el que va diciendo por ahí que el tres en raya es un juego estúpido para niños pequeños?

column4: I'd teach you a lesson myself, but you are not worthy.
column5: Te daría una lección yo misma, pero no estás a mi nivel.

column4: My minions will take care of you.
column5: Mis secuaces se encargarán de ti.

column4: <continue>Daisy! <continue>Nikola! Come here!
Daisy, show him how this game is played!
B-But I barely know how to play…
Then it will be a test to check if he's even competent.
column5: Entonces será una prueba para ver si es siquiera competente.

column4: Daisy will play 6 games against you, but she will start with one point advantage.
column5: Daisy jugará 6 partidas contra ti, pero empezará con un punto de ventaja.

column4: If you can't beat her, you are not worth my time.
column5: Si no eres capaz de derrotarla, no mereces que pierda más tiempo contigo.

column4: I'll go first.
You already won like that before! I'm not that stupid!
column5: ¡Ya has ganado así antes! ¡No soy tan estúpida!

column2: # If IA manages to make a fork

column4: You screwed up!
We tied…
A tie!? That's fucking pathetic, dude.
You say tic tac toe is a stupid game and you can't even win against such a bad player?
column5: ¿Dices que el tres en raya es un juego estúpido pero ni siquiera puedes ganarle a una jugadora tan mala?

column4: Get outta my face!
I won!
You say tic tac toe is a stupid game and you couldn't even win against Daisy?
column5: ¿Dices que el tres en raya es un juego estúpido pero ni siquiera has podido ganarle a Daisy?

column4: That's fucking pathetic, dude.
Go cry somewhere else.
column5: Ve a llorar a otro lado.

column4: I lost…
OK, you were able to beat Daisy.
column5: OK, has sido capaz de derrotar a Daisy.

column4: That just proves you have the barest understanding of the game.
column5: Eso solo demuestra que tienes un entendimiento básico del juego.

column4: Nikola is an actual good player.
column5: Nikola es una jugadora buena de verdad.

column4: Nikola, teach him a lesson! No handicap this time.
column5: Nikola, ¡dale una lección! Esta vez sin ventaja.

column4: You can go first.
I can see what you are trying to do.
column5: Puedo ver lo que estás intentando.

column4: And if I can see it, I can block it!
column5: ¡Y si lo puedo ver, lo puedo bloquear!

column4: That might have worked once, but it won't work a second time.
column5: Puede que eso te haya funcionado una vez, pero no lo hará más.

column4: What!?
Oh, I didn't see that…
It's a tie!
A tie? That's not good enough.
If tying is the best you can do, you need more practice.
column5: Si empatar en lo mejor que puedes hacer, entonces necesitas más práctica.

column4: Get outta here.
I won!
You say tic tac toe is a stupid game and you couldn't even win against Nikola?
column5: ¿Dices que el tres en raya es un juego estúpido pero ni siquiera has podido ganarle a Nikola?

column4: That's sad, don't you think?
Maybe the game is not as stupid as you thought, huh?
column5: Tal vez el juego no es tan estúpido como pensabas, ¿eh?

column4: Go get some practice, loser.
column5: Vete a practicar un poco, perdedor.

column4: No… It can't be…
Nikola! How could you let him beat you!
column5: ¡Nikola! ¡Cómo has podido dejar que te gane!

column4: He… he's actually good!
Nonsense! Move aside!
You won't be able to win against me!
column5: ¡A mi no serás capaz de ganarme!

column4: I don't even need to try to win
column5: I just need to block all your lines.
column7: solo tengo que bloquear todas tus lineas.

column4: That way we will end up in a tie, and you will have proved NOTHING.

column4: What!?
How…?
Gotcha.
Heh, we tied.
You weren't able to defeat me.

column4: If tic tac toe really was THAT stupid, you should have been able to get at least one point over me.
column5: Si el tres en raya realmente fuese TAN estúpido, deberías haber podido sacarme al menos un punto.

column4: You like to talk a lot, but you are not really that good.
